src.inference.utils package¶

Submodules¶

src.inference.utils.carpark_rush_utils module¶

Rush Hour canonicalization and soft-match reward helpers shared by carpark_core.

src.inference.utils.carpark_rush_utils.rush_soft_match_reward(pred_answer_text: str, gold_answer_any: Any, *, weights: Dict[str, float] | None = None, length_penalty_base: float = 0.92) → Tuple[float, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Compute a soft match reward in [0, 1] using only gold sequence(s).

The reward combines several overlap and alignment components between the predicted Rush Hour move sequence and one or more canonicalized gold sequences.

Parameters:

  • pred_answer_text – Raw predicted answer text describing moves.

  • gold_answer_any – Gold answer representation (string or list of sequences).

  • weights – Optional mapping of component names to scalar weights.

  • length_penalty_base – Base used for the exponential length penalty term.

Returns:

Tuple (score, detail) where score is a float in [0, 1] and detail contains canonical forms, chosen gold sequence, and per-component scores.

src.inference.utils.common module¶

Shared inference helpers used across math/carpark/crossword entrypoints. The goal is to keep canonicalization, tag parsing, and small torch utilities in one place so the task-specific scripts stay focused on their domain logic.

Note: lightweight, text-only helpers have been moved to text_utils and torch/generation helpers live in generation to keep this module smaller.

class src.inference.utils.common.MathGatewayDatasetConfig(source: MathGatewayDatasetSource, limits: MathGatewayDatasetLimits, outpath: str, logger: Logger, load_math500_fn: Any, load_remote_dataset_fn: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration for loading and limiting a math gateway dataset.

This class groups related settings into source and limits objects to keep the number of instance attributes small while preserving a backwards-compatible attribute interface.

Parameters:

  • source – Dataset identity and path information.

  • limits – Limiting and caching configuration.

  • outpath – Path to output JSONL file (used to scan existing rows).

  • logger – Logger used for informational messages.

  • load_math500_fn – Callable that loads the MATH-500 dataset.

  • load_remote_dataset_fn – Callable that loads a remote dataset.

property cache_dir: str | None¶

Optional Hugging Face cache directory used when loading datasets.

property dataset_id: str¶

Dataset identifier (for example, ‘MATH-500’ or a HF path).

property dataset_path: str | None¶

Optional local JSONL path for MATH-500-style records.

property from_end: bool¶

Whether examples should be drawn from the end of the dataset.

limits: MathGatewayDatasetLimits¶
load_math500_fn: Any¶
load_remote_dataset_fn: Any¶
logger: Logger¶
property num_examples: int | None¶

Optional cap on the number of examples loaded from the dataset.

outpath: str¶
property seed: int¶

Random seed used when shuffling or subselecting examples.

source: MathGatewayDatasetSource¶
property split: str¶

Dataset split name (for example, ‘train’ or ‘test’).

property start: int¶

Zero-based starting index used when slicing the dataset.

class src.inference.utils.common.StopOnSubstrings(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: StoppingCriteria

Stop generation when any of the provided substrings is seen.

The class encodes stop substrings into token ID sequences for efficient suffix matching on generated token IDs.

has_stops() → bool[source]¶

Indicate whether any stop sequences are configured.

Returns:

True if at least one stop sequence is present, otherwise False.

src.inference.utils.common.build_eos_ids_from_tokenizer(tokenizer, extra_tokens: Sequence[str]) → List[int] | None[source]¶

Build a sorted list of EOS token IDs from a tokenizer, including its native eos_token_id and any additional tokens provided.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer providing eos_token_id, pad_token_id, and convert_tokens_to_ids.

  • extra_tokens – Additional string tokens to treat as EOS.

Returns:

Sorted list of EOS token IDs, or None if none are found.

src.inference.utils.common.build_extra_pass_results_for_cues(*, two_pass: bool, extra_passes: Sequence[Tuple[str, PassOutputs]] | None, pack_result_for_extra: Callable[[str, PassOutputs], Dict[str, Any]], names: Sequence[str] = ('pass2a', 'pass2b', 'pass2c')) → Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Build result dicts for optional multi-cue reconsideration passes (pass2a / pass2b / pass2c) given per-cue PassOutputs.

Parameters:

  • two_pass – Whether second-pass generation is enabled.

  • extra_passes – Optional sequence of (cue_str, PassOutputs) pairs.

  • pack_result_for_extra – Callback that converts a cue and outputs into a result dict.

  • names – Keys to use for extra passes (for example, ("pass2a", "pass2b")).

Returns:

Mapping from pass names to packed result dictionaries.

src.inference.utils.common.build_generate_kwargs(config: GenerateKwargsConfig | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Build generate() kwargs for a given token cap and sampling configuration.

If temperature <= 0 → greedy (do_sample=False) and omit temperature/top_p. Else → sampling with provided temperature/top_p.

Parameters:

  • config – Optional GenerateKwargsConfig container. When omitted, **kwargs is used to build one for backwards compatibility.

  • kwargs – Legacy flat keyword arguments (cap, pad_token_id, etc.).

Returns:

Dictionary of keyword arguments suitable for model.generate.

src.inference.utils.common.build_math_gateway_arg_parser(*, default_temperature: float, description: str | None = None) → ArgumentParser[source]¶

Construct an ArgumentParser with shared math gateway arguments.

This includes output_dir, dataset selection, sampling/budget knobs, and basic seed/step controls. Caller should attach backend-specific arguments (Azure/OpenRouter/Portkey) on top.

Parameters:

  • default_temperature – Default temperature for sampling options.

  • description – Optional help text for the parser.

Returns:

Configured argparse.ArgumentParser instance.

Standard two-message chat for math gateway calls: system + user(problem).

Parameters:

  • system_prompt – System prompt string to use for the chat.

  • problem – Problem text to inject into the user message.

Returns:

List of role/content message dictionaries.

Common prefix for single-pass MATH JSONL rows used by gateway scripts.

Parameters:

  • problem – Normalized problem text.

  • gold_answer – Gold answer value (raw).

  • gold_answer_canon – Canonicalized gold answer, if available.

  • meta – Identifiers for the sample (split, step, sample_idx). For backwards compatibility callers may still pass split, step, and sample_idx directly.

Returns:

Dictionary containing shared row fields.

src.inference.utils.common.build_math_pass_meta(*args, **kwargs) → MathPassMeta[source]¶

Helper to construct MathPassMeta consistently across math inference cores.

This function supports both the newer keyword-only style:

build_math_pass_meta(
    problem=problem,
    canon_gold=canon_gold,
    injected_cue=injected_cue,
    prev_output=prev_output,
    cue_prefix_str=cue_prefix_str,
    stop_reason_think=stop_reason_think,
    stop_reason_answer=stop_reason_answer,
)

and the older positional style used in legacy call sites:

build_math_pass_meta(
    problem,
    canon_gold,
    injected_cue,
    prev_output,
    cue_prefix_str,
    stop_reason_think,
    stop_reason_answer,
)
Parameters:

  • args – Optional positional arguments following the legacy ordering.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments for the keyword-only interface.

Returns:

Constructed MathPassMeta instance.

Raises:

TypeError – If both positional and keyword arguments are mixed or an unexpected number of positional arguments is provided.

src.inference.utils.common.build_retry_context(*, logger: Any, sample_idx: int, problem_snippet: str, min_sleep: float = 10.0) → RetryContext[source]¶

Construct a RetryContext with consistent defaults.

src.inference.utils.common.build_second_pass_cue_strings(phrase: str | None) → List[str][source]¶

Parse a configurable second-pass phrase into a list of cue strings.

Accepts a raw phrase where multiple cues are separated by "|||". Returns each cue with a trailing space, matching the behaviour used by the inference loops.

Parameters:

phrase – Raw configuration string for second-pass cues.

Returns:

List of cue strings with trailing spaces.

src.inference.utils.common.build_second_pass_think_prefixes(*, base2_per_ex: Sequence[str], pre1_think: Sequence[str], row_to_ex_idx: Sequence[int], cue_str: str) → List[str][source]¶

Build pass-2 <think> prefixes aligned with pass-1 rows.

This helper is shared by math_core and math_llama_core to avoid duplicating the row→example mapping logic.

Parameters:

  • base2_per_ex – Base second-pass prompts, one per example.

  • pre1_think – First-pass think-prefix prompts, one per row.

  • row_to_ex_idx – For each row, index of the corresponding example.

  • cue_str – Cue string to inject into second-pass reasoning.

Returns:

List of second-pass think-prefix prompts, one per row.

src.inference.utils.common.build_two_pass_row_base(*, step: int, split_name: str, sample_idx: int, pass1: Dict[str, Any], pass2: Dict[str, Any] | None) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Shared core fields for two-pass rows (carpark/math-llama style).

Parameters:

  • step – Training or checkpoint step identifier.

  • split_name – Dataset split name (for example, "test").

  • sample_idx – Sample index for this generation.

  • pass1 – Packed pass-1 result dictionary.

  • pass2 – Packed pass-2 result dictionary, or None.

Returns:

Dictionary with shared two-pass row fields.

Returns:

Dictionary with prompt_tokens, completion_tokens, and total_tokens fields (possibly None).

src.inference.utils.common.call_with_gateway_retries(func, args: Namespace, context: RetryContext | None = None, **legacy_context: object)[source]¶

Convenience wrapper around call_with_retries using standard CLI args.

src.inference.utils.common.call_with_gateway_retries_compat(call_fn, func, args: Namespace, context: RetryContext)[source]¶

Invoke call_with_gateway_retries while tolerating legacy signatures.

The helper inspects the provided call_fn (which may be monkeypatched in tests) and falls back to positional arguments when the keyword-only context parameter is not present.

src.inference.utils.common.call_with_retries(func, *, settings: RetrySettings, context: RetryContext)[source]¶

Call func() with simple retry-on-exception semantics shared by math gateways.

Parameters:

  • func – Zero-argument callable to execute.

  • settings – Retry settings bundle (counts and backoff).

  • context – Logging context for this call.

Returns:

Result of func() if it eventually succeeds.

Raises:

Exception – Re-raises the last exception if retries are exhausted.

src.inference.utils.common.canon_math(value: str | None) → str | None[source]¶

Permissive canonicalizer for math answers. Lowercases, removes spacing/punctuation, simplifies common LaTeX forms, and normalizes pi.

Parameters:

value – Raw answer text to canonicalize.

Returns:

Canonicalized string, or None if value is None.

src.inference.utils.common.classify_stop_reason(found_stop: bool, has_eos: bool, hit_max: bool) → str[source]¶

Map boolean stop conditions into a standardized stop_reason string.

Parameters:

  • found_stop – Whether a configured stop substring was observed.

  • has_eos – Whether an EOS token was observed in the generated IDs.

  • hit_max – Whether generation hit the maximum new-token cap.

Returns:

One of "stop_token", "eos", "max_new_tokens", or "other".

src.inference.utils.common.configure_tokenizer_and_eos(tokenizer, *, extra_tokens: Sequence[str]) → List[int] | None[source]¶

Apply standard padding/truncation settings and build an EOS-ID list.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer to configure for left padding/truncation.

  • extra_tokens – Additional string tokens to treat as EOS.

Returns:

Sorted list of EOS token IDs, or None if none are found.

src.inference.utils.common.decode_and_score_batch(ctx: DecodeBatchContext) → Tuple[List[str], List[List[float]], List[str]][source]¶

Shared row-wise decode and entropy loop used by math/carpark/crossword helpers.

Parameters:

ctx – Decode context bundling tokenizer, scores, sequences, and config.

Returns:

Tuple (decoded_texts, entropy_series, stop_reasons) per row.

src.inference.utils.common.decode_generated_row(tokenizer, seqs: torch.Tensor, input_lengths: torch.Tensor, row_i: int, *, skip_special_tokens: bool = True) → Tuple[torch.Tensor, str, int][source]¶

Given batched generation outputs, return (gen_ids, decoded_text, start_tok_idx) for a single row.

This de-duplicates the common indexing/decoding pattern used when post-processing HF generate outputs.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer used to decode token IDs into text.

  • seqs – Tensor of generated token IDs for all rows.

  • input_lengths – Tensor of input lengths for each row.

  • row_i – Index of the row to decode.

  • skip_special_tokens – Whether to skip tokenizer special tokens when decoding.

Returns:

Tuple of generated IDs for the row, decoded text, and the start index.

src.inference.utils.common.empty_pass_outputs(total_rows: int) → PassOutputs[source]¶

Construct an empty PassOutputs instance for cases where a pass is skipped (e.g., disabled second pass).

Parameters:

total_rows – Number of rows to represent in the empty outputs.

Returns:

A PassOutputs instance with empty fields.

src.inference.utils.common.entropy_from_start_index(model, seq_ids: torch.Tensor, start_idx: int) → List[float][source]¶

Compute token-wise entropy starting at position start_idx (inclusive). Safe for NaNs thanks to re-centering.

Parameters:

  • model – Autoregressive language model exposing forward with use_cache.

  • seq_ids – 2D tensor of token IDs for at least one sequence.

  • start_idx – Index of the first token at which to begin entropy computation.

Returns:

List of entropy values, one per token from start_idx onward.

src.inference.utils.common.extract_problem_and_answer(example: Dict[str, Any]) → Tuple[str | None, Any][source]¶

Extract a unified (problem, answer) pair from a heterogeneous example dict.

Parameters:

example – Example record with task-specific keys.

Returns:

Tuple (problem, answer) where either element may be None.

src.inference.utils.common.finite_mean(values: Iterable[float]) → float | None[source]¶

Compute the mean of finite values, ignoring NaNs and infinities.

Parameters:

values – Iterable of numeric values.

Returns:

Mean of finite values, or None if no finite values are present.

src.inference.utils.common.first_eos_any(token_ids: torch.Tensor, eos_id_list: Sequence[int] | None) → int[source]¶

Return the first EOS position in a sequence, or full length if absent.

Parameters:

  • token_ids – 1D tensor of token IDs for a single sequence.

  • eos_id_list – Optional sequence of EOS token IDs to search for.

Returns:

Index of the first EOS token, or len(token_ids) if none is found.

src.inference.utils.common.generate_and_score_batch(params: GenerateBatchParams, runtime: GenerateBatchRuntime) → Tuple[List[str], List[List[float]], Any, Any, List[str]][source]¶

Shared generate + decode loop used by math/carpark/crossword cores.

params.config_like must expose eos_ids, entropy_mode, and top_p attributes.

Parameters:

  • params – Static parameters describing prefixes, caps, and config-like object.

  • runtime – Runtime dependencies including tokenizer, model, and torch module.

Returns:

Tuple (decoded_texts, entropy_series, input_lengths, sequences, stop_reasons).

src.inference.utils.common.init_unified_backend_and_eos(*, backend_cls, config: BackendInitConfig | None = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize a backend and a standard EOS-ID list for unified runners.

backend_cls is typically HFBackend, but is passed explicitly so tests can monkeypatch it on the caller module.

Parameters:

  • backend_cls – Backend class exposing from_pretrained.

  • config – Backend/init configuration bundle. For backwards compatibility callers may still pass legacy keyword arguments (model_name_or_path, revision, cache_dir, dtype, device_map, attn_implementation, tokenizer_path) which will be converted into a BackendInitConfig.

Returns:

Tuple (backend, eos_ids) where eos_ids may be None.

  • existing – Mapping from problem to the set of existing sample indices.

Iterator over (problem, gold_answer, sample_idx) tuples.

src.inference.utils.common.limit_dataset_examples(dataset, num_examples: int | None, *, from_end: bool = False, start: int | None = None)[source]¶

If num_examples is set and positive, return a sliced dataset with at most that many rows; otherwise return the dataset unchanged.

The slice location is determined as follows:

  • If start is not None, take num_examples rows starting at that zero-based index (clamped to the dataset length).

  • Else if from_end is True, take rows from the end of the dataset.

  • Otherwise, take rows from the beginning.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Dataset object supporting select and len.

  • num_examples – Maximum number of examples to keep, or None.

  • from_end – If True and start is None, select rows from the end instead of the start.

  • start – Optional zero-based starting index for the slice.

Returns:

Original dataset or a truncated view.

src.inference.utils.common.limit_dataset_for_args(dataset, args)[source]¶

Convenience wrapper around limit_dataset_examples() using runner args.

This reads num_examples, examples_from_end, and dataset_start attributes from args (using safe defaults when absent) and applies the corresponding slice to the dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Dataset object supporting select and len.

  • args – Namespace-like object with dataset-limiting attributes.

Returns:

Original dataset or a truncated view.

src.inference.utils.common.load_local_json_dataset(path: str) → Dataset[source]¶

Proxy to gateway_dataset_utils.load_local_json_dataset() with a patched require_datasets.

  • config – Optional GenerateKwargsConfig container. When omitted, **kwargs is used for backwards compatibility.

If num_examples is set and positive, return a sliced dataset with at most that many rows; otherwise return the dataset unchanged.

The slice location is determined as follows:

  • If start is not None, take num_examples rows starting at that zero-based index (clamped to the dataset length).

  • Else if from_end is True, take rows from the end of the dataset.

  • Otherwise, take rows from the beginning.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Dataset object supporting select and len.

  • num_examples – Maximum number of examples to keep, or None.

  • from_end – If True and start is None, select rows from the end instead of the start.

  • start – Optional zero-based starting index for the slice.

Returns:

Original dataset or a truncated view.

src.inference.utils.gateway_utils module¶

Dataset / JSONL / CLI / gateway helpers shared by inference scripts.

These utilities were previously part of inference.common and are now split out to keep that module below lint size limits. Public functions are still re-exported from inference.common for backwards compatibility.

src.inference.utils.gateway_utils.limit_dataset_examples(dataset, num_examples: int | None, *, from_end: bool = False, start: int | None = None)[source]¶

If num_examples is set and positive, return a sliced dataset with at most that many rows; otherwise return the dataset unchanged.

The slice location is determined as follows:

  • If start is not None, take num_examples rows starting at that zero-based index (clamped to the dataset length).

  • Else if from_end is True, take rows from the end of the dataset.

  • Otherwise, take rows from the beginning.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Dataset object supporting select and len.

  • num_examples – Maximum number of examples to keep, or None.

  • from_end – If True and start is None, select rows from the end instead of the start.

  • start – Optional zero-based starting index for the slice.

Returns:

Original dataset or a truncated view.

src.inference.utils.gateway_utils.limit_dataset_for_args(dataset, args)[source]¶

Convenience wrapper around limit_dataset_examples() using runner args.

This reads num_examples, examples_from_end, and dataset_start attributes from args (using safe defaults when absent) and applies the corresponding slice to the dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Dataset object supporting select and len.

  • args – Namespace-like object with dataset-limiting attributes.

Returns:

Original dataset or a truncated view.

src.inference.utils.generation module¶

Torch/generation helpers shared across inference tasks.

These were split out from common to keep that module smaller while preserving the public API via re-exports.

class src.inference.utils.generation.StopOnSubstrings(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: StoppingCriteria

Stop generation when any of the provided substrings is seen.

The class encodes stop substrings into token ID sequences for efficient suffix matching on generated token IDs.

Indicate whether any stop sequences are configured.

src.inference.utils.generation.build_extra_pass_results_for_cues(*, two_pass: bool, extra_passes: Sequence[Tuple[str, PassOutputs]] | None, pack_result_for_extra: Callable[[str, PassOutputs], Dict[str, Any]], names: Sequence[str] = ('pass2a', 'pass2b', 'pass2c')) → Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

src.inference.utils.generation.build_generate_kwargs(config: GenerateKwargsConfig | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Build generate() kwargs for a given token cap and sampling configuration.

If temperature <= 0 → greedy (do_sample=False) and omit temperature/top_p. Else → sampling with provided temperature/top_p.

Parameters:

  • config – Optional GenerateKwargsConfig container. When omitted, **kwargs is used to build one for backwards compatibility.

  • kwargs – Legacy flat keyword arguments (cap, pad_token_id, etc.).

Returns:

Dictionary of keyword arguments suitable for model.generate.

src.inference.utils.generation.build_second_pass_think_prefixes(*, base2_per_ex: Sequence[str], pre1_think: Sequence[str], row_to_ex_idx: Sequence[int], cue_str: str) → List[str][source]¶

Build pass-2 <think> prefixes aligned with pass-1 rows.

This helper is shared by math_core and math_llama_core to avoid duplicating the row→example mapping logic.

Parameters:

  • base2_per_ex – Base second-pass prompts, one per example.

  • pre1_think – First-pass think-prefix prompts, one per row.

  • row_to_ex_idx – For each row, index of the corresponding example.

  • cue_str – Cue string to inject into second-pass reasoning.

Returns:

List of second-pass think-prefix prompts, one per row.

src.inference.utils.generation.classify_stop_reason(found_stop: bool, has_eos: bool, hit_max: bool) → str[source]¶

Map boolean stop conditions into a standardized stop_reason string.

Parameters:

  • found_stop – Whether a configured stop substring was observed.

  • has_eos – Whether an EOS token was observed in the generated IDs.

  • hit_max – Whether generation hit the maximum new-token cap.

Returns:

One of "stop_token", "eos", "max_new_tokens", or "other".

src.inference.utils.generation.decode_generated_row(tokenizer, seqs: torch.Tensor, input_lengths: torch.Tensor, row_i: int, *, skip_special_tokens: bool = True) → Tuple[torch.Tensor, str, int][source]¶

Given batched generation outputs, return (gen_ids, decoded_text, start_tok_idx) for a single row.

This de-duplicates the common indexing/decoding pattern used when post-processing HF generate outputs.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer used to decode token IDs into text.

  • seqs – Tensor of generated token IDs for all rows.

  • input_lengths – Tensor of input lengths for each row.

  • row_i – Index of the row to decode.

  • skip_special_tokens – Whether to skip tokenizer special tokens when decoding.

Returns:

Tuple of generated IDs for the row, decoded text, and the start index.

src.inference.utils.generation.entropy_from_start_index(model, seq_ids: torch.Tensor, start_idx: int) → List[float][source]¶

Compute token-wise entropy starting at position start_idx (inclusive). Safe for NaNs thanks to re-centering.

Parameters:

  • model – Autoregressive language model exposing forward with use_cache.

  • seq_ids – 2D tensor of token IDs for at least one sequence.

  • start_idx – Index of the first token at which to begin entropy computation.

Returns:

List of entropy values, one per token from start_idx onward.

  • token_ids – 1D tensor of token IDs for a single sequence.

  • eos_id_list – Optional sequence of EOS token IDs to search for.

Returns:

Index of the first EOS token, or len(token_ids) if none is found.

src.inference.utils.generation.repeat_for_samples(values: Sequence[str], num_samples: int) → List[str][source]¶

Repeat each value num_samples times using row-major expansion.

Parameters:

  • values – Sequence of base values to repeat.

  • num_samples – Number of repetitions per value.

Returns:

Expanded list of values repeated for each sample.

src.inference.utils.generation.run_generate_batch(params: GenerateBatchParams | None = None, runtime: GenerateBatchRuntime | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → Tuple[List[str], List[List[float]], Any, Any, List[str]][source]¶

Convenience wrapper that constructs GenerateBatchParams and GenerateBatchRuntime and delegates to generate_and_score_batch().

Parameters:

  • params – Optional pre-built GenerateBatchParams. When omitted, **kwargs is consumed for backwards compatibility with legacy keyword arguments (prefixes, cap, stop_strings, config_like, max_length).

  • runtime – Optional GenerateBatchRuntime. When omitted, **kwargs is consumed for backwards compatibility with legacy keyword arguments (tokenizer, model, torch_module, stopping_criteria_list_cls).

  • kwargs – Backwards-compatible flat keyword arguments.

Returns:

Tuple (decoded_texts, entropy_series, input_lengths, sequences, stop_reasons).

src.inference.utils.generation.tokenize_prefixes_for_generate(tokenizer, prefixes: Sequence[str], *, max_length: int = 4096, device: torch.device | None = None) → tuple[dict, torch.Tensor][source]¶

Tokenize a list of string prefixes for generation and move to device.

This centralizes the common pattern used across math/carpark/crossword inference loops.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer used to encode the prefix strings.

  • prefixes – Sequence of prefix strings to tokenize.

  • max_length – Maximum sequence length used for truncation.

  • device – Optional explicit device to move tensors to.

Returns:

Tuple (inputs_on_device, input_lengths) as in move_inputs_to_device().

src.inference.utils.math_llama_utils module¶

Utility helpers for math_llama_core (kept separate to reduce module size).

class src.inference.utils.math_llama_utils.DSModelWrapper(engine: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Adapter so code can call .generate and .parameters() on a DeepSpeed engine.

This wrapper exposes a Hugging Face-like interface around a DeepSpeed engine so downstream utilities can treat it like a regular AutoModelForCausalLM.

eval()[source]¶

Put the underlying module into eval mode and return self.

Returns:

The current DSModelWrapper instance.

generate(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Forward generate calls to the underlying HF module.

Parameters:

  • args – Positional arguments forwarded to module.generate.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments forwarded to module.generate.

Returns:

Result of the underlying generate call.

parameters()[source]¶

Expose the underlying module’s parameters iterator.

Returns:

Iterator over model parameters.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils module¶

Math-specific result packaging, canonicalization, and tag/entropy helpers.

These utilities were originally defined in inference.common and are split out to keep that module smaller and more focused on torch/transformers glue code. Public functions are still re-exported from inference.common for backwards compatibility.

class src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.MathEntropySummary(overall: float | None, think: float | None, answer: float | None, pre_cue: float | None, reconsider_think: float | None, reconsider_full: float | None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Entropy statistics for a single math pass.

Parameters:

  • overall – Overall token-level entropy.

  • think – Entropy restricted to the think segment.

  • answer – Entropy restricted to the answer segment.

  • pre_cue – Entropy before any reconsideration cue, if applicable.

  • reconsider_think – Entropy over reconsideration tokens in think.

  • reconsider_full – Entropy over reconsideration tokens in think+answer.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.build_math_pass_meta(*args, **kwargs) → MathPassMeta[source]¶

Helper to construct MathPassMeta consistently across math inference cores.

This function supports both the newer keyword-only style:

build_math_pass_meta(
    problem=problem,
    canon_gold=canon_gold,
    injected_cue=injected_cue,
    prev_output=prev_output,
    cue_prefix_str=cue_prefix_str,
    stop_reason_think=stop_reason_think,
    stop_reason_answer=stop_reason_answer,
)

and the older positional style used in legacy call sites:

build_math_pass_meta(
    problem,
    canon_gold,
    injected_cue,
    prev_output,
    cue_prefix_str,
    stop_reason_think,
    stop_reason_answer,
)
Parameters:

  • args – Optional positional arguments following the legacy ordering.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments for the keyword-only interface.

Returns:

Constructed MathPassMeta instance.

Raises:

TypeError – If both positional and keyword arguments are mixed or an unexpected number of positional arguments is provided.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.build_reconsideration_base_kwargs(*, prev_output: str | None, full_text: str, pred_answer_text: str, pred_canon: str, entropy_summary: MathEntropySummary | None) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Common kwargs used when assembling reconsideration-aware pass results.

Assemble reconsideration-related fields shared by math and crossword passes.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.build_second_pass_cue_strings(phrase: str | None) → List[str][source]¶

Parse a configurable second-pass phrase into a list of cue strings.

Accepts a raw phrase where multiple cues are separated by "|||". Returns each cue with a trailing space, matching the behaviour used by the inference loops.

Parameters:

phrase – Raw configuration string for second-pass cues.

Returns:

List of cue strings with trailing spaces.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.build_stop_reasons(stop_think: str | None, stop_answer: str | None) → Dict[str, str | None][source]¶

Helper to normalize stop reasons into a consistent mapping.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.canon_math(value: str | None) → str | None[source]¶

Permissive canonicalizer for math answers. Lowercases, removes spacing/punctuation, simplifies common LaTeX forms, and normalizes pi.

Parameters:

value – Raw answer text to canonicalize.

Returns:

Canonicalized string, or None if value is None.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.contains_canon(hay: str | None, needle: str | None) → bool[source]¶

Substring check after both sides are canonicalized.

Parameters:

  • hay – Canonicalized haystack string.

  • needle – Canonicalized needle string.

Returns:

True if needle is a substring of hay.

src.inference.utils.math_pass_utils.extract_blocks(txt: str) → Tuple[str | None, str | None][source]¶

Extract <think> and <answer> contents from a model output.

Parameters:

txt – Full text containing <think>…</think> and <answer>…</answer> blocks.

Returns:

Tuple (think_text, answer_text) with surrounding whitespace stripped, or (None, None) if blocks are not found.

src.inference.utils.task_registry module¶

Task registry for inference scripts.

This keeps task-specific knobs (prompts, stop tokens, caps, canonicalizers, and dataset loaders) in one place so individual entrypoints can become thin wrappers over a unified driver.

class src.inference.utils.task_registry.DatasetSpec(loader: str, default_id: str | None = None, prompt_column: str | None = None, answer_column: str | None = None, split: str = 'test')[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataset loader specification for a task.

Parameters:

  • loader – Dotted path to a loader function ("module:attr").

  • default_id – Optional default dataset identifier (for example, HF repo ID).

  • prompt_column – Optional name of the prompt column.

  • answer_column – Optional name of the answer column.

  • split – Default dataset split to load (for example, "test").

answer_column: str | None = None¶
default_id: str | None = None¶
loader: str¶
loader_fn() → Callable[source]¶

Resolve and return the loader function described by this spec.

Returns:

Callable that loads the dataset when invoked.

Raises:

ValueError – If the loader path cannot be resolved.

prompt_column: str | None = None¶
split: str = 'test'¶

Whether the task uses a two-pass protocol.

Returns:

True if second-pass inference is enabled.

src.inference.utils.text_utils module¶

Text-only helpers split out from inference.common.

These utilities do not depend on torch or transformers and are shared across math/carpark/crossword inference entrypoints.

src.inference.utils.text_utils.find_markers_and_context(think_text: str | None, prompt_text: str, patterns: Sequence[Tuple[str, Pattern]], *, skip_prefix_chars: int = 0) → Tuple[List[str], int | None, str | None, str | None][source]¶

Scan think_text for the earliest match among patterns.

Parameters:

  • think_text – Model reasoning text (may be None or empty).

  • prompt_text – Prompt text used to build contextual prefixes.

  • patterns – Sequence of (name, regex) marker patterns to search for.

  • skip_prefix_chars – Number of characters at the start of think_text to ignore when searching (for example, injected cues).

Returns:

Tuple (markers, earliest_pos, context_prefix, excerpt) where markers is the list of matched marker names, earliest_pos is the earliest character index of any match, context_prefix is a combined prompt+prefix string, and excerpt is a short window around the earliest match.

Module contents¶

Shared utilities used across inference tasks.

This includes generation helpers, math-specific utilities, backend wrappers, and task registries. Public helpers are still re-exported from the top-level src.inference package where appropriate.
